intro: Linociera foveolata subsp. tomentella, commonly known as the woolly linociera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, or tomentose, foliage, which gives it its subspecific name. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with a distinctive coloration that aids in pollination. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs with diverse ecological roles.
